Class SimpleCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleCanvas
  • public class SimpleCanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a stripped-down version of the Canvas class from the BlueJ team, retaining only the most fundamental features.
    Version:
    Feb 2011
    Author:
    BlueJ team with modifications by Gordon Royle (July 2003) and Rachel Cardell-Oliver

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) class  SimpleCanvas.CanvasPane
      Inner class CanvasPane - the actual canvas component contained in the Canvas frame.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimpleCanvas()
      Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas of size 400x400 with the default title "SimpleCanvas" and with automatic repainting enabled.
      SimpleCanvas​(java.lang.String title, int width, int height)
      Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas with a white background and with automatic repainting after drawing commands.
      SimpleCanvas​(java.lang.String title, int width, int height, boolean autoRepaint)
      Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas of the specified size with a white background.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleCanvas

        public SimpleCanvas​(java.lang.String title,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    boolean autoRepaint)
        Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas of the specified size with a white background. The client specifies whether repainting after a drawing command should be manual or automatic.
        Parameters:
        title - title for the window
        width - the desired width of the SimpleCanvas
        height - the desired height of the SimpleCanvas
        autoRepaint - true for automatic repainting

      • SimpleCanvas

        public SimpleCanvas​(java.lang.String title,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas with a white background and with automatic repainting after drawing commands.
        Parameters:
        title - title for the window
        width - the desired width of the SimpleCanvas
        height - the desired height of the SimpleCanvas

      • SimpleCanvas

        public SimpleCanvas()
        Creates and displays a SimpleCanvas of size 400x400 with the default title "SimpleCanvas" and with automatic repainting enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine​(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2)
        Draws a line on the SimpleCanvas between two points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of the first point
        y1 - y-coordinate of the first point
        x2 - x-coordinate of the second point
        y2 - y-coordinate of the second point

        public void setForegroundColour​(java.awt.Color newColour)
        Changes the colour for subsequent drawing on this SimpleCanvas.
        Parameters:
        newColour - the new drawing colour

      • getForegroundColour

        public java.awt.Color getForegroundColour()
        Gets the colour currently used for drawing on this SimpleCanvas.
        Returns:
        current foreground colour

      • setFont

        public void setFont​(java.awt.Font newFont)
        Changes the font for subsequent String drawing on this SimpleCanvas.
        Parameters:
        newFont - the new Font

      • getFont

        public java.awt.Font getFont()
        Gets the font currently used for String drawing on this Canvas
        Returns:
        current font for canvas

      • drawString

        public void drawString​(java.lang.String text,
                       int x,
                       int y)
        Draws the specified String at the specified location on this SimpleCanvas
        Parameters:
        text - String to write on the canvas
        x - horizontal coordinate (from left) to place text
        y - vertical coordinate (from top) to place text

      • setAutoRepaint

        public void setAutoRepaint​(boolean autoRepaint)
        Sets the repaint mode to either manual or automatic.
        Parameters:
        autoRepaint - automatic repainting if this is true

      • repaint

        public void repaint()
        If a SimpleCanvas does not automatically repaint after each drawing command, then this method can be used to cause a manual repaint.

      • wait

        public void wait​(int millis)
        Causes execution to pause for the specified amount of time. This is usually used to produce animations in an easy manner, by repeatedly drawing, pausing, and then redrawing an object.
        Parameters:
        millis - number of milliseconds to pause for

      • addMouseListener

        public void addMouseListener​(java.awt.event.MouseListener ml)
        listener to wait for mouse clicks
        Parameters:
        ml - the name of the mouse listener
